docs.abstract: Indian Motorcycle unveiled a stylish new bike. It is one of a number of makers taking a daring, and perhaps unexpected, leap with its designs.
docs.snippet: Indian Motorcycle unveiled a stylish new bike. It is one of a number of makers taking a daring, and perhaps unexpected, leap with its designs.
docs.lead_paragraph: A surfer-meets-biker festival in Biarritz, France, was an unlikely backdrop for America’s oldest motorcycle maker to showcase its latest handiwork.

headline.main: Motorcycle Makers Shake Up Designs to Draw New Riders
headline.print_headline: Bike Designers Take Off-Road Edginess to the Streets

docs.abstract: Chinese companies are steering less money into its Belt and Road Initiative, as top officials ask whether borrowers will be able to repay loans.
docs.snippet: Chinese companies are steering less money into its Belt and Road Initiative, as top officials ask whether borrowers will be able to repay loans.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China has spent nearly five years steering an ever-growing stream of hundreds of billions of dollars to a bold plan to gain greater global influence by funding big projects across Asia, Eastern Europe and Africa.

headline.main: China Taps the Brakes on Its Global Push for Influence
headline.print_headline: China Starts Tapping Brakes On Global Push for Influence

docs.abstract: The sandwich chain said a customer died in December after eating nondairy yogurt that mistakenly included dairy proteins.
docs.snippet: The sandwich chain said a customer died in December after eating nondairy yogurt that mistakenly included dairy proteins.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pret A Manger has acknowledged that a second customer died after an allergic reaction to food sold at the popular British sandwich chain.

headline.main: Pret A Manger Says a 2nd Customer Died of Allergic Reaction
headline.print_headline: Chain Reports 2nd Death From an Allergic Reaction

docs.abstract: Weak growth puts Beijing at a disadvantage in dealing with the White House. But more spending and lending could worsen the country’s addiction to debt.
docs.snippet: Weak growth puts Beijing at a disadvantage in dealing with the White House. But more spending and lending could worsen the country’s addiction to debt.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As China’s economy slows and the trade war with the United States intensifies, Beijing’s economic bosses are swinging into action.

headline.main: As Trade War Intensifies, China Moves to Bolster Its Economy
headline.print_headline: Beijing Takes a Gamble on Debt

docs.abstract: Smartphone video, now used to document abuses across the globe, has been crucial in telling the outside world about Syria’s war, says Anne Barnard, Beirut bureau chief for The Times.
docs.snippet: Smartphone video, now used to document abuses across the globe, has been crucial in telling the outside world about Syria’s war, says Anne Barnard, Beirut bureau chief for The Times.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Anne Barnard, The Times’s bureau chief in Beirut, Lebanon, who covers Syria and the Middle East, discussed the tech she’s using.

headline.main: How Syrians Pioneered Digital Tools to Stand Up to Authorities
headline.print_headline: Giving the World a Sharper View of Syria’s War

docs.abstract: China’s stock market has fallen into a bear market and the currency is tumbling on worries about tariffs and China’s efforts to rein in domestic debt.
docs.snippet: China’s stock market has fallen into a bear market and the currency is tumbling on worries about tariffs and China’s efforts to rein in domestic debt.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Months of struggling with economic problems at home and bickering with President Trump over trade are starting to take their toll on China’s financial health.

headline.main: Trump’s Trade Threats Hit China’s Stock Market and Currency
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Trade Threats Send China’s Market Into Tailspin

docs.abstract: The country’s central bank freed up more than $100 billion for lending as Beijing tries to sustain growth without worsening debt problems.
docs.snippet: The country’s central bank freed up more than $100 billion for lending as Beijing tries to sustain growth without worsening debt problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China gave its economy a shot in the arm on Sunday amid signs of a slowdown, as it freed up more than $100 billion for banks to use to help small businesses and heavily indebted companies.

headline.main: China Moves to Shore Up Economy as Slowdown and Trade Fight Loom
headline.print_headline: China Moves to Shore Up Its Economy as a Slowdown and Trade Fight Loom

docs.abstract: Divisions and reversals on trade under President Trump have flummoxed U.S. allies and rivals, who are courting whichever advisers they think will listen.
docs.snippet: Divisions and reversals on trade under President Trump have flummoxed U.S. allies and rivals, who are courting whichever advisers they think will listen.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As the United States challenges Europe, China, Canada, Mexico and much of the rest of the world over trade, deep factionalism within the Trump administration has flummoxed both American allies and rivals. The White House strikes a conciliatory tone one day and a militant one the next, often depending on which Trump advisers are in favor.

headline.main: Within Trump’s Trade Factions, Nations Look for a Friendly Face
headline.print_headline: Looking For Allies Amid Split Over Trade

docs.abstract: The resentment caused by the 2008 financial crisis set off a populist backlash that fomented distrust of expertise and political division, which could have worrying consequences.
docs.snippet: The resentment caused by the 2008 financial crisis set off a populist backlash that fomented distrust of expertise and political division, which could have worrying consequences.
docs.lead_paragraph: This week is the 10th anniversary of the inflection point of the financial crisis: the collapse of Lehman Brothers, the biggest bankruptcy in history. To some, it feels like a long time ago.

headline.main: From Trump to Trade, the Financial Crisis Still Resonates 10 Years Later
headline.print_headline: The Echoes Of Lehman In Our Time Of Distrust

docs.abstract: While having a massage late Sunday, the West Coast-based tech billionaire discussed via text message why he was entering the East Coast-based media industry by acquiring Time Inc.’s flagship publication.
docs.snippet: While having a massage late Sunday, the West Coast-based tech billionaire discussed via text message why he was entering the East Coast-based media industry by acquiring Time Inc.’s flagship publication.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marc Benioff, the chief executive of the software company Salesforce, and his wife, Lynne, said on Sunday that they had agreed to buy Time magazine from Meredith Corporation for $190 million in cash.

headline.main: Marc Benioff Explains Why He Is Buying Time Magazine
